actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Appropriations.
Reported to House from the Committee on Appropriations, H. Rept. 94-1004.
Measure called up by unanimous consent in House.
Referred to Senate Committee on Appropriations.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on Appropriations with amendment, S. Rept. 94-742.
Measure called up by unanimous consent in Senate.
Measure passed Senate, amended, roll call #142 (61-7).

official_title: Joint resolution making emergency supplemental appropriations for pubilc employment programs, summer youth programs, and preventive health services for the fiscal year ending June 30, 1976, and for other purposes.

summary.text: (Measure passed Senate, amended, roll call #142 (61-7)) Makes emergency supplemental appropriations for fiscal year 1976. =Title I:= Appropriates an additional $300,000,000 for liquidation of obligations for waste treatment incurred pursuant to authority under the Federal Water Pollution Control Act (to remain available until expended) to the Environmental Protection Agency. =Title II:= Appropriates: (1) $528,420,000 for comprehensive manpower assistance (to remain available until September 30, 1976) to the Department of Labor; (2) $1,200,000 for temporary employment assistance (to remain available until January 31, 1977) to the Department of Labor; (3) $55,900,000 for community service employment for older Americans (to remain available until June 30, 1977) to the Department of Labor; (4) $135,064,000 for a nationwide influenza immunization program (to remain available until expended) to the Department of Health, Education, and Welfare; and (5) $23,000,000 for community services program (to remain available until September 30, 1976) to the Community Services Administration.

titles.title: Joint resolution making emergency supplemental appropriations for preventive health services for the fiscal year ending June 30, 1976.

Joint resolution making emergency supplemental appropriations for pubilc employment programs, summer youth programs, and preventive health services for the fiscal year ending June 30, 1976, and for other purposes.
